text: I just asked the owner of the noisy dogs to do something about it. Her response: "What can I do?". How do these people run their lives?
@monadic I'll post a message to the ruby amqp list. I don't really know if it's an eventmachine problem or the ruby amqp bindings
@monadic rabbitmq runs out of processes even with +P 131072 and the ruby processes consuming 100% doing sched_yield system calls.
@auxesis and how was you first English beer? And more importantly what was it?
has officially given up on rabbitmq/eventmachine/ruby amqp bindings for high volume stuff. It's just too fragile. Pissed off.
from the erl man page "concurrent processes ... must be in the range 16..134217727" That 128M - 1. That's a fucking big number!
So it turns out my networking problems were all due to a faulty NIC. Sorry Internode.
@mdreid it's such a refreshing change from iinet who blame everyone else but themselves. And ultimately why I moved to another provider.
@freshtonic you're having a pretty bad run of it at moment, hey.
Wow. Internode's technical support are impressive.
is forced to deploy via git patches due to unbelievably shit connectivity. Dear Internode please pick your game up.
wonders why there is a discussion on the couchdb mailing list about scala versus erlang. SCALA IS NOT THE ANSWER TO EVERYTHING.
is struggling to explain the AMQP/Rabbitmq problems so he can send an email to the list.
@freshtonic Lane Cove. A guy I've worked with over the years is starting a fairly large rails project & wanted some advice.
has double booked so can't go to RORO ;-(
has spent most of the day giving a training session for ruby newbies.
has just tried to deploy a cgi script. If anyone tells me that rails is hard to deploy I'll say nothing & punch them in the face.
joy of joys. I've just been stitched up to "investigate" single sign on. <sigh>
is just testing postgres' PITR. Works as advertised. Nice!
has just upgraded vimperator. Lot's of new goodies by the look of it.
is trying to rationalise with the cat about day light savings & why she's not getting fed on time. I'm not sure how successful I'm being!
has just updated http://topikality.com. Still not much there but it's starting to come together.
@mdreid he obviously got that wrong!
@auxesis aren't you supposed to be on holiday?
is stressed and overly tired.
@mdreid there are actually 11. Those who understand binary, those who don't and those who understand gray code.
is listening in some detail to The Stone Roses, Waterfall. Fuck it's good.
@auxesis you've seen more of those buildings than I have now!
@kim_pepper no a big file call screenlog.0 in my cwd. It turned out to be really useful. I am struggling today a bit though ;-)
has just found out that screen allows you log all output. Very nice.
"Rooting Android": http://rubyurl.com/rnJY. That's not cause a giggle or two.
openvz quota are more fucked than I thought: du -hxs / => 9.1G du -h => 287G. WTF.
@copyblogger one of the Great Albums.
du reports 25% disc usage, dk reports 100% disc usage, openvz pretty fucking please sort your quotas out.
@kim_pepper good one!
does sorting out my music collection count as procrastination?
is being vet/dogsbody today for a friend who is in hospital.
@kim_pepper how did Earth Hour go?
is battling with Postgres PITR. It's pretty cool but you have to get it just right ...
@KathrynElliott that kind of leaves chilli water!
@auxesis bon voyage! Have a fantastic trip.
wonders why people always feel the need to apportion blame if something goes wrong. It's not a nice environment to work in.
@KathrynElliott the main one?
@kim_pepper that's a lot of hits.
today is turning out to be quite a sociable day.
has just spent the last couple of hours stood outside talking random codshit with new neighbours. An evening well spent.
@stephenhb that would make you a bad man if you did that.
@lachlanhardy it was purely for financial reasons! Nothing else you understand.
@stephenhb yah the hb finally tweets.
has scratches all down my arm after being viciously attacked by the incredibly cute kitten that lives just up the lane from us.
is happy that the re-architecting that's he's been doing over the last few weeks seems to working very nicely. A good start to the weekend.
@noodlesue um, maybe that's a chick thing. I always cook on a friday. It's usually the same thing mind!
is eating breakfast.
@benaskins now there's something I haven't had for a while!
just found breakfast in the fridge, so I guess no breakfast either. Could explain a few things. <heavy exhalation of breath>.
umm, just realised I haven't had any lunch.
is procrastinating before getting stuck into some eventmachine coding.
wonders if @stephenhb is actually going to tweet.
@auxesis unfortunately it would appear so. <sigh>
just had really good strategy meeting with @Phil_Scott. Our plan to become rulers of the universe is slowly taking shape ;)
@auxesis a friend's father after deleting his "Internet" icon from his desktop called said friend saying "I've deleted the Internet" ...
but before I do apparently, according to Mr Conroy the government has" cracked peer-to-peer". Oh good I can sleep easy tonight.
Going to bed. Angry.
@auxesis I was furious during qanda. The only two people who were worth listening too where Louise Adler & Susan Carland.
And it would appear that Andrew Holt can only be described as a neo-fascist fucktard and I'm censoring myself when I only say fucktard.
just watched qanda on The ABC. So utterly disappointed by Senator Conroy. There is no hope against the impending censorship here.
@ezmobius I agree, chef is sensational. A breath of fresh are compared to puppet.
is pleased that the multi-agent system (or primitive version thereof!) is finally starting to come together.
@noodlesue or a terawatt laser.
@noodlesue I've thought about it. I feel slightly aggrieved that I have to wear ear plugs in my own house because of others ignorance.
has got his tax return. Yah!
@maraby I don't think you're being over dramatic once you go back from dvcs everything just looks plain arkward & unhelpful.
so desperately wants to sleep but there is a party going on and of course the dogs, the fucking dogs.
dear car drivers, please don't get in your car, start the engine and then fuck around doing something with the engine running.
@SoreGums it leaks memory like mad and can't monitor services (http for example).
@glenndavy non gm but I suspect it hasn't spent it's life frolicking in the paddocks.
has just used four options for grep. I think that's the most I've ever used!
@snapperwolf what else would it taste like?
@auxesis I've only used some of the string extensions but I will have a look at some of the other stuff.
is just trying out a new species of tofu.
has just noticed that extlib has got some really useful, general purpose, stuff in it.
@kim_pepper well have a look at this: http://tinyurl.com/cpvj6p. It should cheer you up.
@ezmobius that looks sensational! I'll be performing "no more capistrano" dance today.
@kim_pepper wrong to slice and dice or wrong that it's cool?
@binary42 I think "Nirvana Unplugged" was the best album they did.
Whoa that was a blat from @github.
is getting very frustrated watching a colleague set up ssh tunnels so he can use his gui tools on a remote machine.
wishes companies wouldn't put fish oil in milk and call it "Smart milk".
@mdreid fair enough. I got the wrong end of the stick on that one!
the good thing about having big gaps in your floorboards is that you only have to use the dustpan & brush for the big stuff.
@janl, @jchris, @couchdb et al, well done. I think it's perhaps time I got round to upgrade from 0.7.2!
I'm surprised you need @mdreid. I think you already now the answer.
Dear mythtv if there was an alternative your name would not ever be mentioned in this house ever again. No really I mean it you are shit.
one day, when I grow up, I want to live in a house that works.
is tied and grumpy after been keep up most the night by the yappy fucking dog across the road.
wonders if there is a CD called "Pointless & insipid music for cafes".
is still feeling a little seedy after last nights roro
is it some point of pride that workmen do things in the noisiest way possible.
if anyone is thinking of using monit, you can save yourself a great deal of pain by using something else.
has just realised the strange errors he's seeing in his new openvz slice have been because there is no localhost in /etc/host. Arrrrrgggggg.
